definition[0]: a situation in which someone gains control of a company by buying all or most of its shares
definition[1]: when a person or organization buys a business
example[1]: The company has accepted a buyout offer of $44.50 a share.
definition[2]: when a person or organization buys all the shares in a company owned by a particular shareholder
example[2]: The company said it was continuing to negotiate a buyout of minority stakeholders.
definition[3]: money given to someone to persuade them to leave a company
example[3]: The airline plans to cut its payroll by 5,000, mainly through buyouts.
